reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Smack dab next to the La Motte Picquet Grenelle metro stop, this charming hotel is perfect as a sightseeing homebase. The station is a hub for 3 metro lines and makes quick hops very easy. The neighborhood is filled with cafes, shopping, patisseries, and locals.
reviews.title: Convience at a Bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, and Ecole Miltaire are 5-10 min walk. It makes that evening romantic trek up the Eiffel Tower so easy when you can just stroll back through the park to your comfy air conditioned hotel.
reviews.title: great experience for moderate budget traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Metro does make a bit of noise when it comes by, but is barely noticeable after a hard day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great Find!!! Great Bargain!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a triple room, which was enormous even for the States let alone Europe. The bathroom was very nice and the flat screen TV was a nice surprise. I would recommend staying away from the hotel breakfast. There are better options in the neighborhood. Go exploring.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel tourisme. The room was very clean, the airconditioner worked great, after we figured out how to work it. The location was 20 feet from a good metro, the hostesses were helpful, friendly, and wonderful. It wasn't posh luxury, but for a middle class girl it was great. A neat old building, with character. The halls weren't fancy, but the rooms were thoughtfully decorated and attractive. It felt French not Days Inn. The neighborhood felt safe and although it was busy, it lacked some of the crazied crowdedness that the more upscale, touristy areas seemed to have 24 hours a day. In the evening it was quiet and even peaceful. Grocery store across the street, delicious bakeries on the street, nice cafe bistros. What more could you want for a reasonable price in Paris?
reviews.title: Nice little Paris hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at hotel Tourisme for one week. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone who wants to enjoy Paris without spending a fortune on accommodation.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was said here...perfect location, helpful staff, very clean...
reviews.title: The best value for money in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved Paris very much and want to go back someday...there´s no need to look for another hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (my g/f and me - 30 years old) stayed in this hotel for 10 days (May 08 - May 18, 2009) and we are really, really satisfied.
reviews.title: Ideal Little Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Perfect location (English speaking staff which is very rare in Paris, metro station in front of the hotel, Aiffel tower 10 min. on foot, many restaurants and shops in the street where the hotel is located as well as McDonalds across the street, 3 supermarkets literally across the street - tip: there is a Monoprix mall next to McDonalds, don't be confused and think that there are only clothes and a bakery (extremely delicious choco donuts) inside, although there are not any signs, there is a huge supermarket on the 1st floor, very cheap compared to all other shops, etc.).
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could run out of superlatives describing this hotel given the comparatively low price paid. I can assure you that you will not be able to find a cleaner, friendlier and well located hotel for less in Paris.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can almost guarantee that I will one day return!!!
reviews.title: It's two star rating should be a five star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I unfortunately only had one night in Paris but have no regrets about Hotel Tourisme.The welcome was warm and our room was spacious and comfortable. Nothing was a problem for the staff and they accommodated us with 5 star treatment. We cannot fault the service. Well done and keep up the great hospitality. The location was ideal. Close enough to the Eiffel tower but far enough away to be in an old Paris neighborhood. We will be back.
reviews.title: Hotel run by accountants with no service ethic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price paid per night: 82 euros
reviews.title: Cosy hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would I stay again for the price? No
reviews.title: Really good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed four nights with spouse. Great location - bus and metro right out the door. Walking distance to many attractions. Safe at night, with plenty of shops and restaurants. Room was spacious and clean, with a flat screen. Stayed in #104, which is facing the front/busy main intersection, but we enjoyed the people watching and sounds of the streets during the day/early evening. When windows were closed it was quiet enough for us. Bakery just below, so it smelled like bread a lot! High Speed Internet offered off the lobby area at 2 Euro per 40 minutes. Staff was helpful. Overall very good stay.
reviews.title: Good value & location in Paris center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my wife (her birthday) to Paris for the first time and we stayed 2 nights to take in the main sights. We've been fortunate over the years in being able to stay in some of the best hotels around the world and I was a bit concerned about the Tourisme's 2* rating. I should not have worried!! It's all been said on here by previous reviewers: Location, bistros/cafes on the doorstep, Metro just steps away, comfy rooms, friendly staff, great value etc etc., and it's all spot on. We hope to get back to Paris soon and there is NOWHERE ELSE we would stay.
reviews.title: You don't have to pay a fortune to stay in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the reviews and we are very pleased of our choise. We spent 7 days in the hotel everything was perfect - the room, the stаff .There are unforgettable smell of croissants. Supermarkets, cafes , shops are around.
reviews.title: Great hotel near Eiffel Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great metro station is just in front of the hotel. That is wonderfull after tired day sightseeing in Paris. Eiffel Tower is 10 min walking. It is wonderfull in night with sparkiling lights 10min every hour.It is like Christmas tree. Many landmarks are near by.
reviews.title: Great location, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to see The City of Love and Lights.
reviews.title: Not a huge fan
